CruiseControl.title: Smart Cruise Control
CruiseControl.overview: Maintain a set speed and distance from the vehicle ahead.
steps: Press the 'Cruise' button on the steering wheel.
Accelerate to desired speed and press 'Set-'.
Use the distance button to adjust following gap.

PhonePairing.title: Bluetooth Pairing
PhonePairing.overview: Connect your phone for calls and music.
steps: Press 'Setup' > 'Device Connections'.
Select 'Add New'.
On your phone, select the vehicle name in Bluetooth settings.

CarPlay.title: Apple CarPlay / Android Auto
CarPlay.overview: Project your phone's apps onto the screen.
steps: Connect your phone via USB (or wirelessly if supported).
Follow the prompts on the vehicle screen.
Enable CarPlay/Android Auto on your phone.

LFA.title: Lane Following Assist
LFA.overview: Keeps the vehicle centered in its lane.
steps: Look for the steering wheel icon on the cluster.
Press the steering wheel button to toggle on/off.
Green icon means active.

PowerLiftgate.title: Smart Power Liftgate
PowerLiftgate.overview: Adjust the opening height and speed.
steps: Go to Setup > Vehicle > Door.
Select 'Power Liftgate Opening Speed' or 'Height'.
Stand behind vehicle with key to test Smart Open.

AmbientLighting.title: Ambient Lighting
steps: Go to Setup > Vehicle > Lights.
Select 'Ambient Light'.
Choose your preferred color and brightness.

ChargingBasics.title: EV Charging Basics
ChargingBasics.overview: How to open the port and plug in.
steps: Press the charging door icon or push the door itself.
Plug in the connector until it clicks.
Check the dashboard for charging status.

V2L.title: Vehicle-to-Load (V2L)
V2L.overview: Power external devices with your car.
steps: Plug the V2L adapter into the charging port.
Open the cap and plug in your device.
Press the power button on the adapter.

DigitalKey.title: Hyundai Digital Key
DigitalKey.overview: Use your smartphone as your car key.
steps: Download the Hyundai Digital Key app.
Follow the pairing instructions in the app.
Place phone on the wireless charger to start.

SurroundView.title: Surround View Monitor
steps: Press the 'View' button near the gear selector.
Select different camera angles on the screen.
Automatically activates in Reverse.

BoseAudio.title: Premium Audio Settings
steps: Go to Setup > Sound > Premium Sound.
Adjust 'Centerpoint' or 'Dynamic Speed Compensation'.
Customize equalizer settings.

HDA.title: Highway Driving Assist
HDA.overview: Assists with speed and centering on highways.
steps: Activate Smart Cruise Control on a highway.
Look for the 'HDA' icon in green.
The car will adjust speed to limits automatically.

RSPA.title: Remote Smart Parking
RSPA.overview: Park your car from outside using the key fob.
steps: Exit the vehicle and lock it.
Press and hold the 'Hold' (Remote Start) button.
Press and hold the Forward or Backward arrow buttons.

VisionRoof.title: Vision Roof
VisionRoof.overview: Open the shade for a panoramic view.
steps: Use the overhead console buttons.
One touch to open the shade.
Note: The glass itself does not open on Vision Roof.

HUD.title: Head-Up Display
steps: Go to Setup > Vehicle > Head-Up Display.
Adjust position, brightness, and content.
Select 'Augmented Reality' if available.

DriveModes.title: Drive Modes
DriveModes.overview: Select the right mode for your drive.
steps: Locate the Drive Mode switch/button.
Toggle between Eco, Normal, Sport, and Snow.
Check the cluster for the mode change.

AutoHold.title: Auto Hold
AutoHold.overview: Keeps the car stopped without holding the brake.
steps: Press the 'Auto Hold' button near the gear selector.
Come to a complete stop.
Remove foot from brake; car stays put until you accelerate.

BlueLink.title: Bluelink Setup
BlueLink.overview: Connect your car to the Hyundai app.
steps: Download the MyHyundai app.
Go to Setup > Bluelink > Activate.
Follow the prompts to link your account.

HeatedSeats.title: Heated/Ventilated Seats
steps: Press the seat icon buttons on the console or door.
Red for heat, Blue for ventilation.
Press multiple times to adjust intensity.

RegenBraking.title: Regenerative Braking
RegenBraking.overview: Adjust how much the car slows when you lift off.
steps: Use the paddle shifters behind the steering wheel.
Left paddle increases regen (slower).
Right paddle decreases regen (coasting).

IPedal.title: i-Pedal Mode
steps: Pull the left paddle until 'i-Pedal' appears.
Release accelerator to come to a full stop.
Great for city driving.
